content.question: During the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4068@</annotation> </semantics> </math> hours, water flows into tank A at a rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A16@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per hour. During the same time interval, water flows into tank B at a rate of b(t) liters per hour. Both tanks are empty at time t = 0. The graphs of y = a(t) and y = b(t), shown in the figure above, intersect at t = k and t = 2.416. (a) How much water will be in tank A at time t = 4.5?

frqParts.text: During the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4068@</annotation> </semantics> </math> hours, water flows into tank A at a rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A16@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per hour. During the same time interval, water flows into tank B at a rate of b(t) liters per hour. Both tanks are empty at time t = 0. The graphs of y = a(t) and y = b(t), shown in the figure above, intersect at t = k and t = 2.416. (a) How much water will be in tank A at time t = 4.5?

(b) During the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>k</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F29@</annotation> </semantics> </math> hours, water flows into tank B at a constant rate of 20.5 liters per hour. What is the difference between the amount of water in tank A and the amount of water in tank B at time t = k?

(c) The area of the region bounded by the graphs of y = a(t) and y = b(t) for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2.416</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4216@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is 14.470. How much water is in tank B at time t = 2.416?

(d) During the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2.7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41DD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> hours, the rate at which water flows into tank B is modeled by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>21</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4839@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per hour. Is the difference w(t) - a(t) increasing or decreasing at time t = 3.5? Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
